website_summaries.verdict: This stand is sturdier than many others, and it should last you for years.
pros: This is a solidly built stand that's easy to assemble and has pre-drilled holes in the feet to mount to a surface
Included tool tray has a magnetic strip to hold small parts
The stand extends from 41" to 75", and the clamp fits tubes from 1" to 1.5"
Customers love this stand for its longevity and sturdiness
cons: Some customers found the clamping mechanism to be low quality

customer_reviews.title: Professional level quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the bad reviews are on here unless they changed the design? It clamps, it holds strong, it can even hold by the seat post with all of the weight hanging up front. This bike stand is amazing and very heavy duty. I would recommend it to any one or any shop. Top notch all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Bicycle Racer.

customer_reviews.title: Fits The Bill
customer_reviews.text: Having purchased this back in early 2018 as it's now the latter part of 2020, the Rad Pro stand's proven to be serious bang for the book. Undoubtedly lacking the overall quality of the serious high end 'Professional' stands that are out there, ones for heavy repair shop usage, for this home bicycle mechanic, it definitely works for me. Very easy to assemble, compact, sturdy with a definite feeling of quality in terms of its robustness. Compared to the high end professional stands that are far more expensive, this stand definitely shines and is a purchase made with no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: ChipperTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Works but isn't very good
customer_reviews.text: My bike weighs 27lbs and no matter how tight I make things it will rotate. The clamp knobs are plastic and cheap. I would recommend saving your money and getting something of higher quality. It is functional but is a little bit of a pain to have to adjust things constantly. Take a tire off and it will rotate. Want to have the front high and the back low - good luck - it will rotate. The stand itself once the legs are spread out is stable so no fear of it falling over.
customer_reviews.author: Dooly

customer_reviews.title: Great bike work stand. Don't know how it could be any better.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold my Trek 29er for routine maintenance. It does a great job. Has a small tool tray that I though would be a waste, but now is one of my favorite features. I did have trouble with the rubber end caps slipping off if I didn't get the bike on just right so I used a little superglue and now don't have that problem. I've now used it for a 700 I've been rebuilding as well and it fits both bikes just fine. It's very stable, and has all the necessary adjustments for me. I like that the head rotates and swivels, and there is a bar to lock the handlbar in position.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Using as a Bow vise
customer_reviews.text: The stand works well holding my compound bow by the grip or by the stabilizer. If you are leveling out the bow it works best if you have a good round stabilizer to clamp onto, then you can level all axis. Leveling while clamped on the grip works but takes more time to get level. Holds pretty steady for most work but it will wiggle a little if you are pushing on the bow to tighten screws etc. Yes a dedicated $150-$300 bench mounted bow vise will work better than this, but for under $50 I am very pleased with the stand.
customer_reviews.author: C Galb

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this it is junk
customer_reviews.text: One company will not email back I tryed to contact due to product damage I asked for parts replace they would not let me know if they would help me This product is junk do not buy . Save your money for something else
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Wrobel

customer_reviews.title: 4 years old and works like new.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this four years ago after much research. For the price I figured it would do the job for a couple of years but it has really surprised me. It works great with small and medium bikes but a large unbalanced bike can be a bit of a challenge, but doable. You would have to spend several multiples of this to get something better. It makes maintenance and bike building much easier. If you are a pro and have thousands of dollars in bikes, you may not be happy with it but if you need something that will make maintenance easier on the family bikes and you keep your expectations realistic for the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: R.F.

customer_reviews.title: Not great for an ebike
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much as advertised, although it's not really strong enough for an ebike. It claims to support 66lb but that's quite optimistic. My bike weighs about 60lbs and puts quite a strain on the plastic clamps. I tried extending it out so that the pedal would not hit the vertical shaft and it looked like it would break the top clamp. Also, ebikes tend have a lot more weight at the back (if rear motor with batteries on the back). The top clamp doesn't prevent the bike from swiveling around until it's vertical with the back wheel on the ground. For the price it's OK and probably fine for most non-ebikes.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Not as innovative as an apple corer, but get it anyway
customer_reviews.text: Happy Day! If you do any type of maintenance at all on your bicycle, you need one of these babies. I don't care if it's just to lube the chain or wipe the dirt off, you need this. Man, such a difference to get everything off the floor and up where you can see it. I chose this particular product because the base seemed to have a wider stance than most of the others and the price was decent for my purposes. The handy little tool tray is pretty sexy too. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Dead Mule, John

customer_reviews.title: A quality bike stand
customer_reviews.text: This bike stand had good reviews, so I decided to give it a try. I recently bought a new BMX bike and wanted to do some work on it. The stand itself is very sturdy. I often leave my bike on there for a week at a time. It gets bumped into in the garage, but the stand doesn't budge. Set-up is super easy, and the instructions are easy to follow. I couldn't recommend this stand more.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Like others have written this does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the price for the features. I have a mobile bike assembly business and thought this was a great deal. However after only a few uses it's basically fallen apart, the magnet fell out, the tool holder cracked off, the E-clip fell off, and it's a pain to tighten the adjustment points. On the plus side it's very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Tova-Jesse

customer_reviews.title: If you need a stand to clean your bike and do your occasional tuning then its perfect. The stand works well if the bike is ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews about this part are ridiculous. Its a $60 piece of plastic, if you're expecting a professional grade that you can use at the Tour De France then look elsewhere. If you need a stand to clean your bike and do your occasional tuning then its perfect. The stand works well if the bike is a neutral horizontal position; otherwise, the bike will rotate and it will be difficult to work on it. Honestly, the stand meet my expectations so I can't complain. I gave it a three star rating, because the front handle bar stabilizer was broken during shipping and the tool tray is constantly loose and unstable.
customer_reviews.author: Tiktok

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rack for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros Cheap Holds the bike in place Folds up for storage Cons Tray hits the pedals a lot when you are lubing Not one hand adjustable This is a solid rack for the price, it's adjustable no matter where you want to hold your bike, cross bar or stem. The biggest problem is when you are lubing the chain the pedals often hit the tool tray, which honestly, unless you are setting this up and leaving it, is worthless. It's too shallow and who leaves tools sticking out of a rack you are about to fold up? Overall if you have question between this one and one more expensive, buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: D. P. Breiten

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Being looking at one for sometime. but price was a big factor. send 200 or more or find a cheaper one and hope its good. well i pulled the trigger on this and not unhappy with my choice. first thing i notice is how heavy the box was. got everything assembled and look strong. through my giant 27.5 mt bike on by the seat post and notice that the grip was twisting alittle. undid that and repositioned it by the top bar and it worked great. i usually dont write reviews but this one i had to. saved myself a ton of money that i can put inot my bike
customer_reviews.author: Dave Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Just as great as the pro stands
customer_reviews.text: Wowwww.... its a bit of a joke how well this stand holds up. I mean a joke in reference to how high of a price other companies charge.... how does this do just as well as my friends $200 stand? I trust this for all the work I do on my Ibis Ripmo and on my cheaper commuter bike. I was hesitant about the steering wheel brace, but it works great during brake bleeds. It would be nice if it had a quick release for clamping down, but for the difference between a $200 stand and a $63 stand there’s no reason to complain.
customer_reviews.author: Leif

customer_reviews.title: Overall great and sturdy. Only issue it is missing a knob.
customer_reviews.text: I used it to wash my bike and held pretty good. It did rotate a bit, but you definitely have to twist harder and get it to lock into place. Not sure how to contact the seller directly, but when I received it was missing a blue knob. Hoping if I could get the piece sent over. It is annoying using it at times as it will freely rotate when working on it.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Let's be honest, it's nowhere close to as nice and well built as Park stands, so it's really not worth comparing. Yes, it does have the issue of not holding tight when trying to position the bike at angles off balance. Yes, the wing nut adjuster is a bad design. Other reviewers have come up with work-arounds for its flaws. It does hold a bike sturdy if it is perfectly balanced either right-side up or upside down. If you want the best, buy a Park stand. If you want to spend only $50 and get a stand that will do 91% of what you will need it for (and more if you make some mods), then buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Double check everything
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping for the best from this stand for wanting one for a while but my excitement was short lived when I opened it. The strap that holds the handle bars from moving was broken and the tray that holds your nuts and tools was missing. If my next replacement item is all intact and no parts missing I will change my review.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Mostly garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I believe they sent me a previously damaged item that they received back as a return. The arm that hold the handle bars in place is made incredibly poor. There are 4 plastic pips that 2 rubber straps attach to. One of these pips was already broken and the bag that held this part appeared to already have a hole in it as if it were opened before I got the package. Who ever designed this part had to have done so with the intention of it failing. That's how crappy it is.
customer_reviews.author: D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike work stand!
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I want it to do, hold my bikes in place so I can work on them! I've used it with my road bike, commuter bike, Mountain bike, and my daughters 20" bike. Holds them all in whatever position I put it in. I was a little disappointed in the packaging, not really to Amazon standards, and there was loose nuts and washers inside the box when I opened it. I found a small baggy I'm assuming they were in at one time. Nothing was lost, so I won't deduct a star, but it does seem it could have been packed better.
customer_reviews.author: bwhite757

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, folds up nicely
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, folds up nicely. The handlebar stay pole is way more useful than I anticipated. Probably not all-day-every-day professional grade, but definitely worth it for working on your own bikes. The only thing I'm unsure of is whether claiming it by the seat post would rotate the clamp. I clamp on the top bar, horizontally. Due to a shipping snafu where Amazon refunded $10, I think this cost me like $43 after tax, shipped. Absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: stuffelse

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic never worked well and busted after a couple dozen uses.
customer_reviews.text: Cheep plastic parts. Wouldn't hold bike straight then the plastic clamp which tightend down on the telescope busted. Spend the extra $35 and get a stand with heavy duty parts.
customer_reviews.author: TheTroglodyte

customer_reviews.title: Standing Strong
customer_reviews.text: I set the stand up tonight and it's more sturdy than I expected. I'll get plenty of use out of it for tuning up the family bikes when they need it. The adjustable clamping post has quite a bit of height and makes working on bikes much easier. I just wish companies would stop using so much plastic in their products. This product is about 95% steel though but the clamp and adjusting handles are plastic. Seems to be a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleT

customer_reviews.title: not worth it. cannot hold a bike at an angle.
customer_reviews.text: Is the stand worth the money? For me, no. ended up getting a park tool pcs-10. I cannot get this stand to hold a bicycle on any angle other than how its balanced on the clamp. while it does rotate 360 degrees you cannot tighten the clamp enough to hold a bike at an angle. It DOES hold a bike up in the air, and it would work as a storage stand or even to clean a bike, it just doesn't do it for me to be viable as a work stand.
customer_reviews.author: Joe LegalTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, bulky, stable
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and bulky but stable. The rubbers on the clamps keep sliding off and the twist knobs are not as practical as a quick release when holding up a 35 lbs bike. I’d say it’s a decent deal given the price compared to others, but be aware that it might not be as practical as you were hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Research everything

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for the price
customer_reviews.text: No, this is not a $200 bike stand. But it is quite usable and sturdy. It does seem that you are better off if you balance the bike in the clamps, but I suspect that isn't a problem for the average user. Using it with a 20 lb hybrid and it holds the bike reasonably steady with the clamp on the seat post or down tube. Just got it and if my opinion changes after using it for a time, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: David W. RanckTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike Stand!!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought this stand would hold up, but it is amazing. I put together a mountain bike with this stand holding the frame. It was a heavy bike--at least 30+ pounds--(bought from Nashbar for cheap). It was no problem for this stand. Will love servicing my road bikes after this stand passed the ultimate test!! Be careful not to over tighten the clamps. I stuffed a towel over my bike frame and the added width helped really secure the bike without over tightening the clamps.
customer_reviews.author: Sekhmet2

customer_reviews.title: Great value for less than the cost of a tune-up.
customer_reviews.text: Great stand for the money. Only complaint is that the tool tray mount is too large to mount to the upper part of the post, it has to be mounted on the lower half and gets in the way of the crank when you're running through your gears, so you have to mount it facing away from you. You basically have to reach through the frame of the bike to grab something. All in all though it's a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: The best way to tune your bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Very portable and rugged bike stand well worth the money. When you are done just fold it up and put it back in the box. It is built quite well with solid and sturdy platform. Its adjustable in any way you want your bicycle. I was tinkering with my new bicycle for weeks and broke down to get this bike stand. Before this my bicycle chain kept falling off. This makes it incredibly easy to do fine tune adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: richTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: The stand itself feels like very good quality and it comes already assembled except ...
customer_reviews.text: The stand itself feels like very good quality and it comes already assembled except for 2 pieces. As for fitting the tool tray on I feel like a 5 year old could figure it out I don't understand the confusion with it. It held my cross country bike no problem but the reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because the clamp does not open wide enough to grab onto the Frame of my downhill bike allowing it to slide around. It did hold my downhill bike up though but was kind of scary l. Overall I feel for the price it was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sample789Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but not really great.
customer_reviews.text: It's great for the price, but if you are looking for top quality, look somewhere else. Everything works but not super smoothly. If you can spend more and quality and ease of use are your priorities, there are better options.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer from Redmond, WA

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend even for its price
customer_reviews.text: Clamp will swing around no matter how tight the screws are, I need to use a chair or small table to support the front wheel. Not recommend. Update: After about a year of not-so-frequent usage, I decided to finally throw it and get a proper stand. Probably park tool, the higher price was for a reason. Heck, even the price of this stand is not competitive! There are bike stands with exactly the same design (and the same failure, probably) around 30 dollars. Don't buy this stand, even if you are looking for a cheap bike stand.
customer_reviews.author: QuXiangtian

customer_reviews.title: built to hold
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the box I could tell that the thick pipes for the stem would not be a problem holding up a bike. The bottom and legs are pre-assembled and resemble a folding tripod, but with four legs. Quadpod? I used the stand today and it held my 700c sized bike no problem. I like the added touch of the stiffener rod to hold the handle bars steady. My boss who is an avid bicyclist and iron-man performer even said this was a very good buy. I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Steven L.

customer_reviews.title: it's usable and fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: noticed the weak fragile looking plastic parts so I applied the same hose-clamp fix from another poster. Feeling better now that the plastic parts wont break or fall apart unexpectedly. I'm okay with it at this lower price point, the cheap fix and the rare need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Dowutyalyk

customer_reviews.title: A decent value; somewhat unstable when using force
customer_reviews.text: After looking for a decent stand for periodic bicycle repairs/upgrades, I decided on this one. It's easy to assemble out of the box, and has decent weight and stability for mounting even heavy bicycles to repair. The only issue is that none of the adjustment points, especially the arm that is supposed to hold the bicycle stable, are very strong, even when you tighten the handles as much as you can. This means if you need to do anything with some amount of force (such as tensioning your fixie chain) you must stabilize the bicycle and the stand in order to keep everything still. Altogether not a huge issue, but worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W.

customer_reviews.title: but this bike stand is awesome. The only thing I wish for is maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: Second time buying this product, may not be from the same supplier, but this bike stand is awesome. The only thing I wish for is maybe they coat the product with a water proofing layer, after all this is used to was bikes too. Starting to see rust in places, but some lube should solve the situation, other than that great. I have a carbon fiber Roubaix and it doesn't scratch the frame and securely holds the bike in place without damage to my top tube.
customer_reviews.author: grissom3310

customer_reviews.title: rad bike stand
customer_reviews.text: super skeptical after reading all the reviews,but i figured i really only need it on its balancing point,so it should hold up....I tried other positions(i.e using seatpost,or bottom of triangle.)..and it doesnt really hold well enough where i felt comfortable using that position..For me,the balance point on top bar is the best im gonna get outta this thing...problem with that is it clamps the rear brake line and wont allow me to crank it down...so,4 stars at this point,,and as i continue to use it during the riding season i may follow up then...it beats working on it laying it down..or asking a helper for hands...
customer_reviews.author: ram

customer_reviews.title: Plenty heavy duty to work with
customer_reviews.text: I build motorized bicycles and got tired of slinging up my bikes under the garage door tracks to work on them. This stand holds a large heavy beach cruiser at any angle and height you’d ever need to put one in.
customer_reviews.author: TheDixieDXer

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The stand is performing as I need. I am using it to hold while I clean and adjust bicycle. No heavy maintenance requiring a lot of torque. All the parts assembled easily. Arrived on time everything in good condition. Since it is light and portable it wobbles a little when I extend the arm out to allow clearance to spin the crank. I anticipated that when I ordered the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning my bike is fun
customer_reviews.text: Update: 01/26/2020 I have been using this repair stand since 2015. As I mentioned before this should be owned by every cyclist who is maintaining its own bike. Very handy and easy to use. the folding option helps a lot for storage. I am using it maybe every 2 months. It still looks brand new. no corrosion or discoloration. plastics are still great. no bend in metal parts or plastic grips. Very satisfied Original review: I should buy it for years before. Cleaning my bike is fun now
customer_reviews.author: Busybeeerc

customer_reviews.title: Best Damned Bike Repair Stand for the Money
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this bike repair stand, I had my doubts. It just had to be a piece of junk for the low price, but I was very, very surprised when I opened the box. It is MUCH sturdier than I had anticipated. It was easy to assemble and it works very well. Yeah it's not up to the quality of the Park Professional Repair Stand, but it's nowhere near the cost either. I have a lifetime of working with tools (50+ years) and I think that this is a great bike repair stand for 99% of bicycle owners. You just will not be disappointed with this bike repair stand.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfootwalker1776

customer_reviews.title: This product has performed well and pretty much met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice bike guy, just looking for a bike maintenance stand that would allow me to adjust my two bikes. This product has performed well and pretty much met my expectations. I only have one issue in that the blue rubber caps (protectors) on the clamps keep coming off the clamp. Not ideal when you are mounting the clamp to the bike. I solved the problem by drilling small holes through the cap and clamp four places and using a small cable tie to secure. For me the price matches the quality and fits my needs well.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bess

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stand at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This stand provides a solid, stable platform for bike maintenance. We use it to work on a heavy downhill bike. The stand holds up very well and does not have a lot of shake or play. Clamps are tight, and the entire stand is well-built. Thee are some complaints about the quality of the clamping system. Just be careful and don't be a brute. A little care and it works just fine and won't break. Highly recommended, especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Looks like manufacturer has a shabby packaging department.
customer_reviews.text: Product looks sturdy and well finished. However i received this product with a missing Adjustable handlebar rod and broken clamp. Rest of the product looks fine. I have no clue how to just request for those parts. I tried replacing it, Amazon says new delivery date as end of Oct and they wants me to return the entire product by Oct11th. This is a bit messy. I like the product, I am happy with just receiving replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: venkatgiri vandali

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this becuase of the price. Feels like a product that would cost twice as much. Sets up in three minutes. Surprisingly strong and versatile. I thought, for the price, it would seem flimsy, but it is strong. Locked my bike in to try it out and the main clamp is strong. You feel confident that it is going to hold your bike, no worries. I like the additional clamp for stability, too. This makes a great gift for friends that do not have a stand. It also folds up quickly and easily. Stands vertical. You can put it in your back seat and take it anywhere. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WMom

customer_reviews.title: Works great and only 50$
customer_reviews.text: This stand works great. As others have said the pictures are misleading when it comes to holding the bike in crazy positions. The bike and stand will rotate to the balance point no matter where you clamp it. However there is really no reason to clamp the bike upside down from the chainstay.... When all other stands are 200$ this thing is awesome for 50$. Its a stand, it holds your bike, what else do you need?
customer_reviews.author: Travis Provin

customer_reviews.title: Great Bicycle Work Stand
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bicycle work stand. Very stable and user friendly. Well worth it. Easy to assemble, fold up and store.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Most important feature failed instantly
customer_reviews.text: Clamp that determines height snapped during first usage. It should have easily been able to hold up my road bike (less than 20 lbs). I'm only giving 2 stars because otherwise it seemed to be a sturdy and well built product.
customer_reviews.author: MaladyofMortality

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again without hesitation
customer_reviews.text: This a really nice bike stand. Not flimsy and NOT too heavy. My only complaint is that it would not keep a bike held at an angle. The bike kept wanting to fall back to level while working on it. I tried cranking down the adjustment knob, but could only go so far being the knob is plastic. All and all, I would buy this stand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, not great
customer_reviews.text: It works and for the price it's a huge improvement over not having one. The main issue I have with this stand is that you can't operate the frame clamp with one hand. You need to hold a bolt with one hand while screwing (closing) the clamp. This means you can only attach the bike from the horizontal tube of the frame and if you don't have an horizontal tube you can't do it. The workaround is to remove the clamp from the stand, attach it to the frame while the bike is on the ground and slide it back in once attached to the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Missing "Spare Part"
customer_reviews.text: This arrived missing the bracket to attach the tool tray to the stand; attempts to contact the manufacturer for this part have gone unanswered.
customer_reviews.author: catherine

customer_reviews.title: Let the RAD ccycle bike stand give you a hand
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these now. I really like them and they are great for working on your bicycle and cleaning it too. It's an amazing value for the money. I've had my original one now for over a year and it's still holding up. Granted,,, it is alot of plastic parts but, they are holding their own.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: It's a good stand - the tool shelf is weak
customer_reviews.text: Holds my 50 lb eBike just fine, but the plastic tool holder cracked a bit when installed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: i am a novice and built 2 bikes on this and use it weekly to throw up my bike and give it a good cleaning, adjusting
customer_reviews.text: well built affordable rack for home bicycle maintenance, building. i am a novice and built 2 bikes on this and use it weekly to throw up my bike and give it a good cleaning, adjusting, and what not. swivels 360, easy up and down, and rock stable. highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle bar holder broke straight out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The little plastic nub that holds the band that holds the handle bar broke as soon as I took it out of the box. Besides that it works ok for the price. It would be better if the clamps were metal instead of plastic. The bikes move a lot if you have to torque on them and I have to be careful to balance my fat bike on it or the clamp won't hold it up
customer_reviews.author: Grayv

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: OK for the price, but definitely not for regular use. You need 3 or 4 hands to use this thing. Too many of the adjustments which should have one end locked in place don't, leaving you trying to hold 2 sides of a screw attachement vice while balancing your bike's greasy chain on your legs. I still use this a bit, but often just as easy to flip my bike upside down, which is exactly what I was trying to avoid when I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Stokes-Rees

customer_reviews.title: This stand is pretty good and excellent value compared to park tool etc ...
customer_reviews.text: This stand is pretty good and excellent value compared to park tool etc It is pretty heavy given the steel construction so fine if you don't need to move it around much but not great if you plan to transport it I'm securing a light 17lb carbon road bike and have no issue securing by the seat post and locking in place at any angle. It allows easy drivetrain maintenance and cleaning. Exactly what I wanted For the price this can't be beaten
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, does the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this. I have used it quite a bit and have not had the troubles that some others have. I found the price unbeatable. I have a Giant 19" mountain bike with a very large tube on the lower frame which the jaws of the stand will not fit around. I have to use the top tube of the frame which is a bit of a challenge if trying to adj any cable tension as the jaws interfere. For the price and light repair/maintain, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the negative remarks about this stand, I found none of them to be true. It's very sturdy, easy to assemble. Well balanced, the only thing to watch out for his how far out the legs extend, easy to trip over. The attachment for the handlebar worked great. There is a slight wobble to the bike on the stand but it did not cause any problems. It folds up nicely and fits in a corner out of the way. You are not going to get anything better at this price level.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: i have no idea why it took me so long ...
customer_reviews.text: i have no idea why it took me so long to get 1 of these makes fixing a flat so much easier then flipping it upside down on the cement then trying to turn it back over so this came in handy very well, it holds the bike at the right hight for me so i have it at eye level to fix my bike
customer_reviews.author: christopher johnson

customer_reviews.title: Official Bike Mechanic Now
customer_reviews.text: I feel official with this stand. A lot of other stands are twice the price and this one is perfect. It makes working on my bike so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Jewell

customer_reviews.title: This is one really good stand. I have nine bikes
customer_reviews.text: This is one really good stand. I have nine bikes, and ran through maintenance on all but my tandem, which this would not hold. Articulating arm works as suggested. Easy adjustments, solid clamps, feet adjust and can be screwed down. Folds up tight. I have had it for a week, and am really happy with it. I dont know if it will stand the test of time, but my guess is that it will. Would recommend for the active rider.
customer_reviews.author: C & S

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: As long as you understand this is a PORTABLE repair stand, this is a very good choice. Quite stable and relative easy to move around, a very good compromise. Nicely designed and easy to assemble. Decent quality of material and workmanship. Of course it can built sturdier and more solid in its operation, but probably wont be at this price and weight. And not one that you can move with in 10 seconds and one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Collectorque

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike stand in May 2013 based on the price and reviews on Amazon. I had looked around for other stands but the next price point seemed to be around $110 which I felt was too much. This stand is easy to assemble and surprisingly heavy and robust. It is extremely stable and I can manouvre my bikes into several positions for easier access for assembly, parts replacement and general cleaning. The stand can be folded up neatly and stored in a closet without taking up much space. I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive solutution for general bike maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Simon W

customer_reviews.title: Marked as NEW but clearly a return
customer_reviews.text: This product is decent enough, but I am bothered that I thought I was buying something brand new but was clearly a return. Some of the pieces were in a ziplock bag, and the box was all mangled. The stand works fine, but we had to jerry-rig the handlebar holder a little bit and use bungee cords. There was no way we'd be able to get the straps that came with it attached. This could be why it was returned... You get what you pay for though. It is a decent enough stand for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Zalewski

customer_reviews.title: not for Ebikes
customer_reviews.text: but other than that these are tits! great price fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: SeeYouBrokeItLook

customer_reviews.title: Good for light duty.  Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: First impressions: A lot more sturdy with and more metal construction than I thought. Good for light duty repair work- indexing gears etc. Probably not good for pulling off a crank or heavier handed projects. Holds my 61 cm road bike frame no problem so far. For the price, 4 stars. The claw grip could be improved.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Town

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I would give 4.5 if I could. THere are these little blue rubber gripps on the arm that grabs the frame or post of the bike and they come off quite frequently. Not a show stopper I glues mine down. Absolute steal for the money though.
customer_reviews.author: Krys

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for a good price
customer_reviews.text: My husband has put off buying a bike stand because he didn't want to spend the money. Then he found this stand. He LOVES it. It's simple and folds up, and holds his expensive bike so he can clean it and work on it and it has never let him down.
customer_reviews.author: Karol

customer_reviews.title: The stand works great, I am sure there are stronger and more ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price this was no brainer. The stand works great, I am sure there are stronger and more useful stands, but I've used this stand for straight two weeks now. It's a big flimsy when attaching the bike by a seat post, but having a carbon fiber frame I can't attach it by the frame. It sure makes it nice to have this stand for regular cleaning and tune ups. It's definitely worth $50 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K

customer_reviews.title: Great device. Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Very well made. It supports my cruiser and my mountain bikes, one at a time. The design allows many positions and angles to access different parts of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike repair stand
customer_reviews.text: Well made bike repair post. Very steady legs and is easy to put up and take down once the work is done.
customer_reviews.author: luvspanties

customer_reviews.title: Great bike stand
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used this on my carbon frames as well as my aluminum and I've had no issues. You can gently grab the carbon so you can work on the bike. If you want something that doesn't break the bank this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybones

customer_reviews.title: This bike maintenance stand is perfect
customer_reviews.text: This bike maintenance stand is perfect. Very well built. It should last a lifetime. It made it very easy for me to adjust my bike derailleurs.
customer_reviews.author: gyro

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and fast shipping. Quality father and son time building his bike.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: This rack is okay for the price. There is no teeth on the spindles to hold the moving parts ridgid like most bike stands. You really have to crank down on everything to get it to stay. Even then, wrenching on the bike it still moves/swivels. The rubber covers on the clamping part also slide off a lot. You'd habe to silicone, or glue them on to stay.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, the tool tray is ok but gets in the way more than it helps. The clamp works if applied to the horizontal tube but sucks when trying to clamp a seat post. It doesn't like to clamp on to odd shaped tubes like that of my carbon fiber road bike, but it is better than vo stand.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Andersen

customer_reviews.title: RAD Bicycle Stand
customer_reviews.text: Read the review on a few stands and was about ready to buy a different stand until I saw this one. I use it for my road bike and my wife's road/trail bike. It has performed flawlessly for me so far and I'm very happy with it. Perfect for home bicycle maintenance, just wish the tool tray was bigger.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good stand
customer_reviews.text: I think this bike stand is very good. After reading about some of the negative reviews, I am not having the same problems as them. The stand is made of good quality materials and it does exactly what is supposed to and the price is very low. I would have given it 5 stars if the clamps were quick release instead of a knob which you need to manually turn. I would definitely recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Overall a pretty good stand. I used it more or less weekly for 6 months or so with my heavy Salsa Merrikhsh with good success. The clamp is bit fiddlely to use, hard to get it to lock down fully. A good deal for occasional use or as a cleaning stand but really not ideal for bike building or serious use. Was close to 4 stars but the difficulty of locking it down makes it a 3 star
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: GREAT for price. Stable. The dial for clamps could be better, but works fine. Comes with a magnetic tray, and that is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Good boy

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it
customer_reviews.text: It was well packaged and meets all my expectations, note that I have a 34 lb bike, hand no problems Just buy it!!!!!! PS I got it in one day but the delivery point of origin was the same state that I love in.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH

customer_reviews.title: Just past two week!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful!! It's broken easily. By the way I bought it accidentally. 😭😭😭
customer_reviews.author: Huntori

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, sturdy bike rack for the price. I was able to put it together very quickly and easily (sub 10 minutes solo). Held a light triathlon bike to a heavy mountain bike with no issues in the stability or structure. Shipping was fast and arrived a day earlier than expected. I have already recommended this item to two friends.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: The concept of the stand is good one of the plastic clamps bro they would be ...
customer_reviews.text: The concept of the stand is good one of the plastic clamps bro they would be better off made out of metal that when all the pieces work is very easy to work on your bus
customer_reviews.author: Lscrivie

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: My first one had a bent bolt but got a replacement through amazon. This stand works well for tuning and adjustments of any bike. positions the bike so you can work ergonomically correct. It holds the bike well when the bolts are secured. I chose this model because it is very compact for storage when not in use. It is very solid when set up, no fear of it tipping over. Hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Fun

customer_reviews.title: Works well. The mount is a little 'fussy' but ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The mount is a little 'fussy' but that's part due to my mtn. bike's frame design. Makes most repairs/maintenance items easier to tackle.
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: No matter how much I tighten the clamp, my bike will move around when working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Strong!!
customer_reviews.text: Great and strong product, perfect to work in my 50 pound bike without issue
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Berrios Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing but cheap enough to keep
customer_reviews.text: It does not hold the bike in an unbalanced position. The "clamp" that holds the bike by the frame or seat post cannot be operated with one hand cause both the butterfly nut and the hand turn, turn together making impossible to tighten. With that said it is cheap enough so i'm too lazy to take it apart box it up and return it.
customer_reviews.author: KingJames

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but a part broke after two uses.
customer_reviews.text: Used to assemble my latest bike, and work on several others. The handlebar stay broke after two uses (the peg to hold the rubber bad broke off), but the rest seems well made, Not worth returning the whole thing (I have a bike hanging on it right now anyway)
customer_reviews.author: Peter Mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Must have Bicycle Repair Stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bicycle repair stand, the best I've seen so far. I found it very sturdy, can hold a variety of bikes at various angles. Perfect for teaching my son how to fix and tune his bikes. We're loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Moncher

customer_reviews.title: bike just fine. It's easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: It holds my hybrid, and therefore slightly heavier, bike just fine. It's easy to setup, small enough to store in my very small 2 car garage with the 2 cars in it and plenty of other crap. This things is great!
customer_reviews.author: Brent Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. I have a 40 pound bike MTB ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I have a 40 pound bike MTB and it felt stable on this stand. Height of the stand is adjustable. The handlebar rod was very useful to stabilize front wheel while changing the brakes. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with this purchase. Base is adjustable so it doesn’t take up too much space. Easy to assemble and holds the bike in place perfectly. Def. would recommend to other buyers especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Terrence

customer_reviews.title: very good stand
customer_reviews.text: very heavy stand. well pleased.. compares to others costing twice as much
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: For $50 best stand ever
customer_reviews.text: Little hard with my 50 lbs Ebike, but a great stand
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and great price point
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and great price point. Gets the job done when needing to work on your bike. I've already recommended this to a couple of friends.
customer_reviews.author: W. Rosensteel

customer_reviews.title: Good price good stand
customer_reviews.text: Good stand for the price does the job and my 14 year old assembled it in no time , I recomend this if your your looking for a good deal
customer_reviews.author: Mr Happy

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction and can fold down for easy storage
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction and can fold down for easy storage. The tool table has a magnetic bottom to keep tools in place and in easy reach. the brackets keep the bike in a sturdy position for all bike maintenance and cleaning needs. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ELIZABETH from Queens, NY

product_meta.title: RAD Cycle products Pro Bicycle Adjustable Repair Stand Holds up to 66 Pounds or 30 kg with Ease for Home or Shop Road Pro Stand
product_meta.description:
Introducing the all new, RAD Cycle Products Pro Bicycle Repair Stand. This is the one everyone is talking about, but you can only get it here. The Rad Cycle Products Pro Bicycle Stand holds up to 66 pounds (30kg) effortlessly in its heavy duty "Work Horse" clamps that are engineered not to harm your bike's finish. The "Work Horse" clamps are designed to rotate 360 degrees on two axes, and fits nearly every standard tube frame from 1" to 1.5".

Included is a tool tray with a magnetic strip to help keep those nuts and bolts where you can find them when it comes time to put them back on. The feet are even pre-drill just in case you want to mount your RAD Cycle Products Pro Bicycle Stand to the floor or work bench permanently, or semi-permanently.

Because the Pro Bicycle Repair Stand is so versatile, you can mount your bike in almost any position and lock it in place with a simple twist of a knob or two. The adjustable handlebar rod stabilizes the front wheel for easier repairs. The Pro Bicycle Repair Stand has everything you are looking for in a repair stand: Durability, ruggedness, versatility, and it all folds up to conveniently store away.

Features:

 * Maximum capacity of 66lbs/30kg.
 * Telescoping stand adjusts from 41" to 75"
 * Heavy duty construction
 * Work Horse clamps fit nearly all standard frames from 1" to 1.5"
 * Clamps hold tight but won't damage your bike's finish
 * Clamps rotate 360 degrees for easy access to every part of your bike
 * Adjustable handlebar rod stabalizes the front wheel
 * Super easy setup and assembly
 * Legs fold for easy storage
 * Pre-drilled holes in feet for anchoring to surfaces
 * Hex key included
 * Tools Not Included.
feature_bullets: ►HEAVY DUTY - Maximum capacity of 66lbs/30kg due to heavy duty construction. Pre-drilled holes in feet for anchoring to surfaces
►ADJUSTABILITY - Telescoping stand adjusts from 41" to 75", and will fit standard frames with 1" to 1.5" tubing
►CONVENIENT - Clamps hold tight but won't damage your bike's finish, rotates 360 degrees for easy access to every part of your bike
►VERSATILITY - Adjustable handlebar rod stabalizes the front wheel, legs fold up for easy storage or transport
►CONVENIENCE - Super easy setup and assembly, hex key included

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
